FuncDef:
The netbios-type command configures the NetBIOS node type of the clients of an address pool.
The undo netbios-type command restores the default setting.
By default, no NetBIOS node type is configured for an address pool.
CLIs: undo netbios-type { b-node | h-node | m-node | p-node }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the broadcast mode. That is, the mapping between the host name and IP address are obtained by means of broadcast.
-

Indicates the hybrid (h) mode, namely, the b-node with the peer-to-peer communication mechanism.
-

Indicates the mixed (m) mode, namely, the p-node with the broadcast feature.
-

Indicates the peer-to-peer mode. That is, mappings are obtained by means of communicating with the NetBIOS server.
-

Examples: Info: It's successful to create an IP address pool
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The netbios-type command is configured in the address pool view to establish a mapping between the host name and IP address in the NetBIOS communication over the WAN.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
